title: AI can dramatically speed up digitizing natural history collections
description: A new study from UNC-Chapel Hill researchers shows that advanced artificial intelligence tools, specifically large language models (LLMs), can accurately determine the locations where plant specimens were originally collected, a process known as georeferencing.
content: A new study from UNC-Chapel Hill researchers shows that advanced artificial intelligence tools, specifically large language models (LLMs), can accurately determine the locations where plant specimens were originally collected, a process known as geor... [2618 chars]

title: To AI or not to AI? Do college students appreciate the question?
description: Students are using AI tools more than ever. An Angelo State University professor designed a way to figure out if his students were using artificial intelligence on a recent paper.We speak with Will Teague, who says students are sacrificing their own agency to artificial intelligence. For sponsor-free episodes of Consider This, sign up for Consider This+ via Apple Podcasts or at plus.npr.org. Email us at considerthis@npr.org.This episode was produced by Henry Larson and Karen Zamora, with additional reporting by Ayana Archie and Lee V. Gaines. It was edited by Justine Kenin and Courtney Dorning. Our executive producer is Sami Yenigun.
content:
Students are using AI tools more than ever.
An Angelo State University professor designed a way to figure out if his students were using artificial intelligence on a recent paper.

title: LLMs, Multimodal, and Distillation: Test Your AI Lingo in This Quiz
description: Test your AI knowledge with this jargon quiz covering artificial intelligence, machine learning, and current tech terms used by experts and execs.
content:
Do you know the difference between a multimodal model and a world model? Do you know your GPUs from your TPUs?

title: How robots like ANYbotics' Roberta are improving industry inspection

title: Softbank's Son says super AI could make humans become like fish
description: Softbank CEO and AI investor Masayoshi Son said Friday that advanced artificial intelligence could surpass humans to the extent that "we become fish" and could even win the Nobel Prize in Literature. title: Real or fake? Researchers to develop tool that would help courts spot AI evidence
description: As artificial intelligence makes it easier for anyone to doctor – or even fabricate – videos, photos and other types of evidence, a group of researchers in Canada is aiming to help the courts sort through what’s real or fake.
content:
As artificial intelligence makes it easier for anyone to doctor – or even fabricate – videos, photos and other types of evidence, a group of researchers in Canada is aiming to help the courts sort through what’s real or fake.

title: Meta partners with news outlets to expand AI content
description: Meta announced Friday it will integrate content from major news organizations into its artificial intelligence assistant to provide Facebook, Instagram and WhatsApp users with real-time information.
